sentences.en: "Crops are the first level in the food chain, " he told SciDev.Net. "When people make it uneatable to certain insects, we need to understand how it might affect the whole ecosystem."
sentences.cn: “农作物是食物链中的第一个环节，”他对SciDev.Net表示，“当人们将它变得对某些昆虫而言不可食用时，我们需要了解整个生态系统可能受到的影响。”

sentences.en: The beef was underdone and quite uneatable.
sentences.cn: 这牛肉未熟透,简直不能吃.

sentences.en: The bread, bad enough in the morning, was now positively uneatable; it was so hard that even the strongest jaws could make little impression on it.
sentences.cn: 早上的面包已经够糟糕了，晚饭的面包却变本加厉得坏，根本不能吃，它是如此之坚硬，叫牙口最好的人见了也一筹莫展。

sentences.en: The English country gentleman gallop after a fox - the unspeakable in full pursuit of the uneatable.
sentences.cn: 策马奔驰于狐狸之后的英国乡绅 - -拼命追求不可吃的东西的一类不可以言语的东西.

sentences.en: The vegetables had been boiled to a mush, and were quite uneatable.
sentences.cn: 菜煮烂了, 都没法吃了.

words.tran_cn: 不能吃的；不适合食用的

trans.tran_en: a word meaning unpleas­ant or unsuitable to eat, that some people think is incorrect
